thread.title: Gemma Atkinson makes 'hungover' appearance on Lorraine after guzzling 'train tipples' with Emmerdale's Mark Charnock
thread.title_full: Gemma Atkinson makes 'hungover' appearance on Lorraine after guzzling 'train tipples' with Emmerdale's Mark Charnock

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Gemma Atkinson makes 'hungover' appearance on Lorraine after guzzling 'train tipples' with Emmerdale's Mark Charnock
text:
Gemma Atkinson makes 'hungover' appearance on Lorraine after guzzling 'train tipples' with Emmerdale's Mark Charnock Emmerdale actress was thankful for a drink of water Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Did Gemma Atkinson arrive HUNGOVER? Share this video Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Gemma Atkinson might have looked flawless on Lorraine this morning, but the Emmerdale actress was actually feeling a bit worse for wear. 
The 32 year old admitted that she was feeling "hungover" after hauling herself out of bed early for the show. 
"Hangover water," she laughed as Lorraine introduced her on the show. 
And it seems her antics with co-star Mark Charnock the night before might have something to do with her condition on the early show. 
"We were on the train drinking wine," he admitted. (Photo: ITV) Gemma got the train down to London with her co-star Mark Charnock (Photo: Instagram/glouiseatkinson) 
The pair took the train down to London together yesterday evening – and enjoyed a few "train tipples" on their journey. 
"What's all this booze?" she asked in a video shared on Instagram. 
Mark seemed to be enjoying a small bottle of wine while Gemma had a tin of gin and tonic. She enjoyed a gin and tonic (Photo: Instagram/glouiseatkinson) Mark had a small bottle of wine (Photo: Instagram/glouiseatkinson) Instagram 
Later on Lorraine, the actress hinted that her Emmerdale character Carly Hope could be about to leave the soap. 
Last night's episode saw Marlon walk in as Carly did nothing to help April when she violently choked on a sweet at a party. 
“It’s terrifying even when we filmed it, it was horrible to watch," Gemma told Lorraine Kelly this morning. 
"Carly’s already lost her baby Bobby to cot death so it’s too much pressure, she doesn’t want it to happen again." Gemma Atkinson admits filming choking scenes was 'terrifying' (Photo: ITV) She hints Carly Hope could leave the soap (Photo: ITV) Carly still has feelings to work through (Photo: ITV) 
And when asked if Carly will leave the soap, she admitted her character does has a tendency to run for the hills. 
“She’s one of those people that instead of facing a problem, she just runs from them," she said. 
“We’re dying for Marlon to say come back and we’ll make it work." Carly does nothing to help when April chokes Marlon walks in and is shocked that Carly doesn't react 
But Carly still has a lot of feelings to work through. 
“She’s not grieved for her son,” she said. 
* Emmerdale is on at 7pm tonight on ITV Like us on Facebook
